main event: A civilian observer spotted a bright white light in the sky near Osceola, Arkansas in March 1967.
interesting points: The object appeared brighter than a star in the western sky.
The object appeared to be stationary at first, then started moving to the south.
The object's behavior and appearance resembled a KC-135 aircraft with powerful floodlights, which was confirmed to be in the area at the time.
The observer was shocked and awed by the sighting, and was concerned about other similar sightings reported in the Osceola area.

The report includes detailed weather and wind conditions at various altitudes, as well as information about two aircraft from Blytheville AFB that were in the vicinity around the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a bright white light in the sky
